data.title: The New Herald News LLC.
data.meta_description: News for Lincoln IL and Logan County IL
data.text:
MASON CITY, IL - Carolyn "Janeâ Pottorf, 90, of Mason City passed away Sunday, August 25, 2024 at St. Claraâs Manor in Lincoln.Â She was born on December 2, 1933 in Easton to Howard and Bird (Bonham) Corbin.Â On August 14, 1955 in Easton, she married Richard "Zekeâ Pottorf who preceded her in death in 2009.Â Jane is survived by 2 children:Â Pam (Rod) Conklen of Hartsburg and Howard Pottorf of Tipp City, Ohio, 4 grandchildren: Sara (Brian) Boerma, Katie (Taylor Ferrill) Conklen, Olivea (Ben Folkens) Pottorf, Lucas Pottorf, and 5 great-grandchildren:Â William, Emma and Ruby Boerma and Zeke and Stetson Ferrill.Â She was preceded in death by her parents, husband, 2 brothers, 2 sisters and 3 infant grandchildren. Jane earned her bachelorâs degree from Illinois State University and went on to work for over 40 years as a schoolteacher at Easton schools and then Illini Central in Mason City.Â She was proud to be born and live on the family farmÂ south of Teheran for many years.Â She was a member of the Easton Methodist Church.Â Jane enjoyed spending 2 weeks in Minnesota every year.Â Â Her favorite activity was time spent with her kids, grandkids and great-grandchildren as they affectionately called her Grandma Jane and GG.Â A funeral service will be held on Friday, August 30, 2024 at 11:00 AM at Hurley Funeral Home in Mason City, Pastor Dawn Bevan will officiate, with visitation beginning at 9:30 AM and going until the time of service at 11:00 AM, burial to follow at Mason City Cemetery.Â Memorial contributions may be made to the Easton United Methodist Church or Donorâs Choice.Â Online condolences can be left at www.hurleyfh.com.Â Â Hurley Funeral Home in Mason City is in charge of the arrangements.Â

SPRINGFIELD, IL âÂ Sandra L. Green Kitchen, 83, of Springfield, formerly of Lincoln and Atlanta, passed away at her daughterâs home on Wednesday, August 21, 2024. Graveside Services for Sandra will be held on Saturday, August 24, 2024, at 1:00 p.m. at Zion Cemetery. Sandra L. Green was born June 30, 1941, in Lincoln, the daughter of Russell and Wilma Shawgo Green. She was united in marriage to Richard Kitchen in Springfield on August 26, 1968. He preceded Sandy in death February 10, 2013. Sandy is survived by her children: Gilbert Gresham, Mark (Clara) Gresham, Lisa Shaffer, Michelle (Brian) Geiger, and Shannon (Freddie) Outlaw; many grandchildren and great-grandchildren; and two sisters: Mary (Wade) Howe and Mary Jane (Roger) Cook. She was preceded in death by three sisters: Patricia James, Wanda Westfall, and Linda Leesman. She was a homemaker and loved to craft, especially knitting and crocheting. Sandy enjoyed cooking and baking, making homemade fudge and peanut brittle. She loved growing and canning vegetables, and shopping at garage sales and using coupons. Memorials may be made to Atlanta Rescue Squad. Final arrangements are entrusted withÂ Quiram-Peasley Funeral HomeÂ of Atlanta.

LINCOLN, IL - Lela Mae Rust, 92, of Lincoln, passed away August 12, 2024, at her residence. Graveside services will be held at a later date.Â Holland Barry & Bennett Funeral Home is assisting the family. Lela was born November 10, 1931, in Kearney, Nebraska, the daughter of Richard Webb and Sadie (McKinney) Webb.Â She married Fred Rust in 1952.Â He preceded her in death in November of 1989. Lela graduated from Kearney High School in 1949.Â She was a bookkeeper by trade.Â She was an avid golfer and a member of the Lincoln Elks 914 Ladies Golf Association and the Emblem Club.Â She was also a member of the Lincoln College Auxiliary and Lincoln Womanâs Club.Â Â She is survived by her nieces and nephews:Â Allen R. Webb, David Webb, Kathy Roberts, and Marjorie Periera-Webb as well as several great nieces and nephews and extended family members. She was preceded in death by her parents, husband Fred, and brother Lonnie L. Webb. Memorial donations may be made to the Lincoln Elks 914 Emblem Club and will be accepted at the funeral home.

LINCOLN, IL - Elsie Winchell, 87, of Lincoln, IL, passed away on Sunday, August 18, 2024, at St. Claraâs Rehab and Senior Care. Elsie was born August 31, 1936, in Golconda, IL, the daughter of James Arlie and Lela Chloe (Robinson) Stephens. She married Doyle Winchell on February 6, 1960, in Atlanta, IL. He preceded her in death in 2018. Elsie is survived by her daughters, Mary (Jim Kirkpatrick) Blain and Tammy (Tom) Haferkamp; five grandchildren, Jeremiah (Rachel) Koester, Benjamin (Jessica) Koester, Jordan (Ashley) Blain, Macie (James) Monroe, and Moriah Blain; six great-grandchildren, Judah, Rebecca, Raiden, Greyson, Malakai, and Truett; and her sister, Shirley Williams. She was preceded in death by her parents, husband, Doyle; infant son, Todd Winchell; grandson, Nathaniel Koester; and her siblings, Marie Hunter, Dorothy Lang, Sidney Stephens, and Essie Usherwood. A private family service will be held for Elsie. Burial will take place at Zion Cemetery in Lincoln. Memorials may be made in Elsieâs name to the International Federation of Christians and Jews. Arrangements have been entrusted to Fricke-Calvert-Schrader Funeral Home in Lincoln.

MASON CITY, IL â Fern M. Turley, 97, passed away on Wednesday, August 14, 2024, at Mason City Area Nursing Home. Graveside Services will be held at 11:00 a.m. on Tuesday, August 20, 2024, at Lucas Chapel Cemetery in rural New Holland. Mr. Ryan Edgecombe will officiate. Fern Melvene Turley was born October 19, 1926, in Lincoln, the daughter of Oria Julius and Flo Margurette Aery Smith. She was united in marriage to James Virgil Ellison in 1945 in Lincoln. She later married Charles E. Turley in 1974 in New Holland. He preceded Fern in death in 2018. Fern is survived by her daughter, Rebecca E. Ellison of Kimberling City, MO; sister, Joyce J. Pinney of Lincoln; and numerous nieces and nephews. She was preceded in death by two husbands, daughter Janice K. Ellison, three brothers, Oria J. Smith, Jr., Donald D. Smith, and Jack A. Smith; three sisters, Margurette Smith, Mary Ellen Bennett, and Decemma Mae Armstrong; and several in-laws, nieces and nephews. She loved her family and everyone else her whole life. Fern worked for Ellison Automotive, the KEG Lounge and Restaurant, Lincoln China Factory, operated Beason CafÃ©, The KEG Lounge and Restaurant, and several retail sales operations in Branson, Missouri. She enjoyed bowling, knitting, and sewing when time allowed. She became a resident of The Christian Village in early December 2018, enjoying their spiritual care program by Pastor Ryan Edgecombe throughout her journey with dementia. Recently, she moved to Mason City Area Nursing Home. Dr. Dennis Caroll and his medical care improved her day-to-day functioning tremendously. Memorial donations may be made to a place of the donorâs choice. Peasley Funeral Home of Lincoln is in charge of arrangements.

CLINTON, IL â John R. Plotke, Jr., 44, of Clinton, passed away at his home on Tuesday, August 13, 2024. Cremation Rites have been accorded. A Celebration of Life will be held at Quiram-Peasley Funeral Home in Atlanta on Sunday, August 18, 2024, from 2:00 p.m. â 4:00 p.m. John Robert Plotke, Jr. was born May 28, 1980, the son of John Robert and Marlene Punke Plotke, Sr. He was united in marriage to Toni Henderson on November 11, 2000. She survives. John is also survived by six children: Weslee (Destiny Johnson) Plotke, Trista (Aaron Kruszwicki) Plotke, Lily Plotke, Isabelle Plotke, Desiree (Caleb) Smith, and Breanna (Gavin) Burton; five grandchildren: Emmett, Oakley, Jerry, Kye, and Jax; two sisters: Penny Sympson and Christina Tennison; two brothers: Joseph Plotke and Jeffrey Plotke; and his father, John R. Plotke, Sr. He was preceded in death by his mother, one brother, Jamie Plotke, and one daughter, Emma Plotke. John was a lead at Stericycle. He enjoyed fishing, building motorized bicycles, and talking on his CB radio. Memorials may be made to his family. Quiram-Peasley Funeral Home of Atlanta is assisting the family with arrangements.

CLINTON -Â John R. Plotke, Jr., 44, of Clinton, passed away at his home on Wednesday, August 15, 2024, at 12:20 a.m. Funeral arrangements are pending with Quiram-Peasley Funeral Home of Atlanta.

LINCOLN - Fern M. Turley, 97, of Lincoln passed away on Wednesday, August 14, 2024 at the Mason City Area Nursing Home in Mason City. Funeral Arrangements are pending at the Peasley Funeral Home in Lincoln.

LINCOLN, IL â Gary B. Leesman, 78, of Lincoln, formerly of Atlanta, passed away on Friday, August 9, 2024, at his home. Graveside Services for Gary will be held on Friday, August 16, 2024, at 10:00 a.m. at the Atlanta Cemetery. Pastor Paul Weber will officiate. Cremation Rites have been accorded. Military Rites will be accorded Atlanta American Legion Post #341. Gary Blain Leesman was born December 5, 1945, in Atlanta, the son of Clarence and Clara Mae Gillard Leesman. They preceded Gary in death. Gary is survived by one daughter, Stephanie (Joseph) Fulkerson of Lincoln, and one son, Keith Leesman of California; three granddaughters: Lanae (Blake Byrge) Laubenstein, Chloe Laubenstein, and Brynley Laubenstein; one great-granddaughter: Presley Byrge; two brothers: Wayne (Margaret) Leesman and Larry (Glenna) Leesman; and one sister, Darlene Leesman. He was preceded in death by one infant daughter, Rhonda Leesman, and one sister, Carol Estes. Gary attended Atlanta High School and then served in the United States Navy. He had worked as a cook at the Tropics in Lincoln. Gary enjoyed fishing, riding his electric bicycle, and being outdoors. Memorials may be made to St. Jude Childrenâs Research Hospital or his family. Final arrangements are entrusted with Quiram-Peasley Funeral Home of Atlanta.
